title: South Coast Wonders

quote.text: Nature is not a place to visit. It is home.

shortSummary: Journey along Iceland's dramatic South Coast with Heather, discovering waterfalls you can walk behind, impressive black sand beaches, and coastal rock formations.
summary: Welcome Heather to your adventure as you explore Iceland's dramatic South Coast! Today features iconic waterfalls, including one you can walk behind, dramatic black sand beaches, and breathtaking coastal landscapes. From the thundering Sk√≥gafoss to the hauntingly beautiful black sand beaches with their towering sea stacks, today's journey showcases the raw power and beauty of Iceland's southern shoreline.

schedule.description: Enjoy breakfast at your accommodation before starting your South Coast adventure.

schedule.title: Meet Heather
schedule.description: Heather joins your journey today. Make sure you have everything packed and ready for her arrival.

schedule.title: Drive to Seljalandsfoss
schedule.description: Head east along the Ring Road (Route 1) to your first waterfall destination.

schedule.title: Seljalandsfoss Waterfall
schedule.description: Experience the unique opportunity to walk behind this 200-foot waterfall. The path that circles behind the curtain of water offers an unforgettable perspective, though prepare to get a little wet!
details: 60-meter (200 foot) high waterfall fed by the Eyjafjallaj√∂kull glacier
One of the few waterfalls in the world you can walk behind
Waterproof clothing recommended as the spray is significant
Best photographed in afternoon light, but morning has fewer crowds
quickStops: Glj√∫frab√∫i - hidden waterfall just a 5-minute walk north through the canyon

schedule.title: Drive to Sk√≥gafoss
schedule.description: Continue east along Route 1 to your next waterfall destination.

schedule.title: Sk√≥gafoss Waterfall and Hiking Trail
schedule.description: Witness the power of this massive 200-foot waterfall and climb the 527 steps to the viewing platform at the top for panoramic views. This is also the starting point for the famous Fimmv√∂r√∞uh√°ls hiking trail.
details: 60-meter (200 foot) high waterfall with a 25-meter width
Climb 527 steps to the upper viewing platform for spectacular views
On sunny days, the spray often creates single or double rainbows
According to legend, a treasure chest is hidden behind the waterfall
quickStops: Sk√≥gar Museum - folk museum displaying Icelandic cultural heritage (if time permits)

schedule.title: Drive to Vikurfjara Black Sand Beach
schedule.description: Continue along the Ring Road to the impressive black sand beaches.
quickStops: S√≥lheimaj√∂kull Glacier Viewpoint - quick stop for glacier views from the parking area

schedule.title: Vikurfjara Black Sand Beach
schedule.description: Explore this less crowded alternative to Reynisfjara with dramatic black sand and oceanic views. This beach was specifically recommended by your friends as a highlight of the South Coast.
details: Less crowded alternative to the more famous Reynisfjara beach
Expansive black sand beach with dramatic mountain backdrops
Excellent views of Dyrh√≥laey arch in the distance
Always keep a safe distance from the water - sneaker waves are dangerous

schedule.title: Reynisfjara Black Sand Beach
schedule.description: Visit Iceland's most famous black sand beach with its impressive basalt columns and Reynisdrangar sea stacks rising from the ocean.
details: Famous hexagonal basalt columns form a natural wall along the beach
Reynisdrangar sea stacks visible offshore - according to legend, they are trolls turned to stone
IMPORTANT: Be extremely cautious of sneaker waves - never turn your back to the ocean
Can be very crowded with tourists during peak hours

schedule.title: Dyrh√≥laey Peninsula
schedule.description: Visit this small peninsula with a large sea arch and lighthouse. In July, you'll have a good chance to spot puffins nesting on the cliffs.
details: 120-meter high promontory with magnificent views in all directions
Large sea arch that's large enough for boats to pass through
Important breeding grounds for puffins (best viewing May-August)
Two levels to explore - upper (lighthouse) and lower (black sand beach)

badWeatherAlternatives.description: Comprehensive folk museum showcasing Icelandic history and culture with both indoor and outdoor exhibitions including historic turf houses.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Lava Centre

badWeatherAlternatives.description: Indoor/outdoor swimming pool with hot tubs, located near Sk√≥gafoss. A great way to relax in bad weather.

tip: Be extremely cautious at all black sand beaches in Iceland, especially Reynisfjara. Never turn your back to the ocean and stay at least 30 meters from the water's edge. Sneaker waves have claimed lives here, even on calm-looking days.
notes: Most restaurants along the South Coast close early (around 9pm), so plan dinner accordingly.
Consider stocking up on some groceries as options are limited after Selfoss.
